section.title: Logging on .NET Connector Server
section.para: The .NET Connector Server tracing is built on top of System.Diagnostics.
The Framework and Connectors by default use this method everywhere. TODO Write something short because the Microsoft page contains everything.

There is only one place where the Framework use this methods and it's the "ConnectorServer". This is used when the FacadeDisposer is invoked. The ICF 1.1 was a stateless and every allocated resource was released. The ICF 1.4 introduced new statefull configuration which is kept in the Facade. Time to time if it's not used it has to be disposed. The disposure evets are using this:new TraceSource("ConnectorServer");

section.title: Logging on Java Connector Server
section.para: How to change the default StdOutLogger to something else? It has three ways and they take this precedence order:
1. System property: Start the server with -Dorg.identityconnectors.common.logging.class=
2. set it in the connectors.properties file. Default location
3. Use the classpath META-INF/services/org.identityconnectors.common.logging file<name of the LogSpi implementation>

note.para: If you use the SLF4JLog you don't need to do anything because it use the 3rd method to configure the Logger. It's enough to add to the classpath only

section.title: Logging Level Mapping
section.para: The different underlying logger has different level configurations and convention. This table show how they are mapped together.

section.title: Logging with Logback
section.para: The OpenICF Java Connector Server ZIP is package with Logback by default. If you use the ConnectorServer to start the service it sets this system property "-Dlogback.configurationFile=lib/logback.xml"
section.programlisting:
<configuration>
<property name="SERVER_LEVEL" value="INFO" /> <property name="LOGS_FOLDER" value="${CONNECTOR_SERVER_HOME}/logs" /> <appender name="SERVER-FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender"> <file>logs/ConnectorServer.log</file> <append>true</append> <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy"> <fileNamePattern>logs/ConnectorServer-%d{yyyyMMdd}.log</fileNamePattern> </rollingPolicy> <encoder> <pattern>%-4relative [%thread] %-5level %logger{35} - %msg %n</pattern> </encoder> </appender> <appender name="TRACE-FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender"> <file>logs/ConnectorServerTrace.log</file> <append>true</append> <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy"> <fileNamePattern>logs/ConnectorServer-%d{yyyyMMdd}.log</fileNamePattern> </rollingPolicy> <encoder> <pattern>%-4relative [%thread] %-5level %logger{35} - %msg %n</pattern> </encoder> </appender> <appender name="CONNECTOR-FILE" class="ch.qos.logback.core.FileAppender"> <file>logs/Connector.log</file> <append>true</append> <rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.TimeBasedRollingPolicy"> <fileNamePattern>logs/Connector-%d{yyyyMMdd}.log</fileNamePattern> </rollingPolicy> <!--rollingPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.FixedWindowRollingPolicy"> <fileNamePattern>${LOGS_FOLDER}/my-application-troubleshooting.%i.log</fileNamePattern> <maxIndex>10</maxIndex> </rollingPolicy> <triggeringPolicy class="ch.qos.logback.core.rolling.SizeBasedTriggeringPolicy"> <maxFileSize>10MB</maxFileSize> </triggeringPolicy--> <encoder> <pattern>%-4relative [%thread] %-5level %logger{35} - %msg %n</pattern> </encoder> </appender> <appender name="STDOUT" class="ch.qos.logback.core.ConsoleAppender"> <layout class="ch.qos.logback.classic.PatternLayout"> <Pattern>%d{HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%thread] %-5level %logger{36} - %msg%n</Pattern> </layout> </appender>

<root level="debug"> <appender-ref ref="STDOUT" /> </root>

section.para: In this configuration the logs from ICF ConnectorServer and the Connectors are separated.
